alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 25 at 1:32PM CDT until October 25 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Kimble County in west central Texas... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 129 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Junction to London. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. 1.15 inches have fallen at the Junction airport in the last hour and 1.45 inches at a Texas Mesonet station 1 miles southwest of Junction Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction, Segovia, Yates Crossing, South Llano River State Park, London, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290 and I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 451 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
